p: The antibacterial effect of the components (different extracts, essential oils, total alkaloids, and some individual compounds) from Lagochilus species were evaluated [ 5, 6, 7, 19, 21, 24, 88]. The results indicated that the components of L. ilicifolius, L. cabulicus, L. acutilobus, L. gypsaceus, L. inebrians, L. olgae, L. proskorjakovii, L. setulosus, L. vvedenskyi had weak antibacterial effects on human pathogens ( Table 8). However, Taban et al. [ 19] reported that the essential oil obtained from the flowers of L. kotschyanus showed strong inhibitory activity against Gram-positive bacteria S. pyogenes, S. agalactia, and B. anthracis (MIC 3.1 mg/mL).
